content.text: HTML Background Images
A background image can be specified for almost any HTML element.
content.html: A background image can be specified for almost any HTML element.

content.text: Background Image on an HTML element
To add a background image on an HTML element, use the HTML style attribute and the CSS background-image property:
content.html: To add a background image on an HTML element, use the HTML style attribute and the CSS background-image property:

content.code_html: <p style="background-image: url('img_girl.jpg');">

content.text: You can also specify the background image in the <style> element, in the <head> section:
content.html: You can also specify the background image in the <style> element, in the <head> section:

content.code_html:
<style>
p {
  background-image: url('img_girl.jpg');
}
</style>

content.text: Background Image on a Page
If you want the entire page to have a background image, you must specify the background image on the <body> element:
content.html: If you want the entire page to have a background image, you must specify the background image on the <body> element:

content.code_html:
<style>
body {
  background-image: url('img_girl.jpg');
}
</style>

content.text: Background Repeat
If the background image is smaller than the element, the image will repeat itself, horizontally and vertically, until it reaches the end of the element:
content.html: If the background image is smaller than the element, the image will repeat itself, horizontally and vertically, until it reaches the end of the element:

content.code_html:
<style>
body {
  background-image: url('example_img_girl.jpg');
}
</style>

content.text: To avoid the background image from repeating itself, set the background-repeat property to no-repeat .
content.html: To avoid the background image from repeating itself, set the background-repeat property to no-repeat.

content.code_html:
<style>
body {
  background-image: url('example_img_girl.jpg');
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
}
</style>

content.text: Background Cover
If you want the background image to cover the entire element, you can set the background-size property to cover.
content.html: If you want the background image to cover the entire element, you can set the background-size property to cover.

content.text: Also, to make sure the entire element is always covered, set the background-attachment property to fixed:
content.html: Also, to make sure the entire element is always covered, set the background-attachment property to fixed:

content.text: This way, the background image will cover the entire element, with no stretching (the image will keep its original proportions):
content.html: This way, the background image will cover the entire element, with no stretching (the image will keep its original proportions):

content.code:
<style>body {  background-image: url('img_girl.jpg');  
background-repeat: no-repeat;  background-attachment: fixed;
background-size: cover;
}</style>
content.code_html:
<style>
body {
  background-image: url('img_girl.jpg');
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
  background-attachment: fixed;
  background-size: cover;
}
</style>

content.text: Background Stretch
If you want the background image to stretch to fit the entire element, you can set the background-size property to 100% 100% :
content.html: If you want the background image to stretch to fit the entire element, you can set the background-size property to 100% 100%:

content.text: Try resizing the browser window, and you will see that the image will stretch, but always cover the entire element.
content.html: Try resizing the browser window, and you will see that the image will stretch, but always cover the entire element.

content.code:
<style>body {  background-image: url('img_girl.jpg');  
background-repeat: no-repeat;  background-attachment: fixed;
background-size: 100% 100%;
}</style>
content.code_html:
<style>
body {
  background-image: url('img_girl.jpg');
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
  background-attachment: fixed;
  background-size: 100% 100%;
}
</style>

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct CSS property for defining background images?
content.html: What is a correct CSS property for defining background images?

metadata.question: What is a correct CSS property for defining background images?

content.question: What is a correct CSS property for defining background images?

content.text: Learn More CSS
From the examples above you have learned that background images can be styled by using the CSS background properties.
content.html: From the examples above you have learned that background images can be styled by using the CSS background properties.

content.text: To learn more about CSS background properties, study our CSS Background Tutorial .
content.html: To learn more about CSS background properties, study our CSS Background Tutorial.
